medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral distal leg weakness, numbness, and worsening mobility.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 weeks ago with bilateral distal leg weakness and numbness. A 4-week history of tingling in all fingers was noted. Six months prior, the patient experienced bouts of generalized tiredness lasting minutes, which progressed to prolonged episodes lasting up to 2 hours. One month later, he developed bilateral calf tightness and occasional imbalance while walking. On presentation, numbness had advanced from the feet to the knees, leading to a broad-based gait and reliance on walking aids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hemochromatosis (C282Y homozygote), receiving venesections every 3 months.
medical_history.social_history: Nonsmoker; consumes 12 units of alcohol per week.
